poem:
Title: A Winter Prelude

White robed, the land calls us
to a quieter pace. Weather, the hand
of God, traces lines of white across the isle,
slow trains and pensive faces at the pane.
Why shirk this deliberate fall of sky?
Lean in, listen to the silence,
ponder His design, His weathered rhyme.
Courage, traveller. A higher script
guides our journey through this temporal frost.
